1.title: Wilf's Story
1.plot: The chaplains at Birmingham Children's Hospital offer support to 80,000 young patients every year. The first programme in this series following the emotional and spiritual rollercoaster of their work.

2.title: At Birmingham Children's Hospital, the Chaplains Support a Father Stepping in to Save His Baby Daughter's Life by Donating a Part of His Own Liver.
2.plot: At Birmingham Children's Hospital, the chaplains support a father stepping in to save his baby daughter's life by donating a part of his own liver. And they offer spiritual strength to the family of a seven-year-old boy battling a cancerous tumour for the third time.

3.title: The Parents of Three-year-old Viyan Shah Have Just Been Told That His Cancer Has Returned. After 18 Months of Clear Scans the News Is Devastating.
3.plot: The parents of three-year-old Viyan Shah have just been told that his cancer has returned. After 18 months of clear scans the news is devastating. It's the job of Hindu chaplain Rakesh Bhatt to support the family as they face up to the diagnosis.

4.title: On the Teenage Cancer Ward a 15-year-old Boy Is Treated for Leukaemia.
4.plot: On the teenage cancer ward a 15-year-old boy is treated for leukaemia. On the renal ward, a 15-year-old girl faces surgery to remove her transplanted kidney which has stopped working, and it is the only one she has.

5.title: KK Needs a Life Saving Heart Transplant Is Baptised in the Hospital Chapel.
5.plot: At Birmingham Children's Hospital, the chaplains support a young rugby player who is undergoing brain surgery. His promising career on the pitch is now over.

6.title: The Chaplains at Birmingham Children's Hospital Are Called to the Parents of a Newborn Baby with Suspected Meningitis.
6.plot: They support the family of Stanley, who after spending the first year of his life in hospital, must have major heart surgery to get home. The table is turned on one of the chaplains whose six-year-old daughter has to come into hospital.

locations: Birmingham Children's Hospital, Birmingham, West Midlands, England, UK
imdb.title: Children's Hospital: The Chaplains
plot: Series follows multi faith chaplains as they support children and their families in Birmingham children's Hospital. Narrated by Julian Rhind-Tutt.::Paul Nash
